articles.content:
Demonstration Staged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Heads and at least 700 members of fishery cooperatives across south Korea staged a demonstration in Seoul on March 23
in denunciation of the passage of "The Takeshima (Tok Islet) Day" ordinance by the Shimane Prefectural Assembly, Japan, according to south Korean KBS.
 They demanded Japan to retract the ordinance and the south Korean government authorities ensure their stable activities in the waters around Tok Islet.

articles.content:
DPRK's Cause of National Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Ismail Omar Guelleh, president of Djibouti, supported the reunification of Korea when receiving credentials from DPRK
Ambassador to Djibouti O Ul Rok on March 21.
 He said that leader Kim Jong Il has conducted energetic activities to achieve the reunification of Korea as early as possible.    
 He went on to say: The people of Djibouti know well that the reunification of Korea has been obstructed by foreign forces' interference and outsiders do not want to see  Korea reunified to emerge a political, military and economic power.    
 We are confident that the Korean people will remove all obstacles lying in the way of reunification and achieve it. 
It is the sincere and strong hope of Djibouti to boost the relations of friendship and cooperation with the DPRK.

articles.content:
Egyptian Party Supports DPRK's Counter-Measure 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's counter-measure based on its peculiar and traditional principle of reacting to dialogue with dialogue and
countering force with force startled the world once again. We hail this counter-measure as a just one reflecting the strong will of the Korean people who consider its sovereignty and dignity as something dearer than their life and highly appreciate it.  The Liberal Party of Egypt said this in a statement issued on Mar. 22 in support of the February 10 statement of the DPRK Foreign Ministry in which it solemnly declared it would suspend its participation in the six-party talks for an indefinite period and bolster its nuclear arsenal for self-defence in order to cope with the U.S. imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK.
 The statement continued:    
 If the U.S. truly wants a peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue and peace and security on the Korean Peninsula, it should meet the just demand of people's Korea that the U.S. roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK. This is the only way of protecting world peace and security.

Bangladeshi Independence Day Observed
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held here on Mar. 26 on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the independence of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.
 The meeting heard a congratulatory speech by the chairman of the Korea-Bangladesh Friendship Association and adopted a message of greetings to the Bangladeshi president.    
 At the end of the meeting the participants enjoyed an art performance given by students of Korea-Bangladesh Friendship Pyongyang Puksu Middle
School.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of the late Song Se Chang, former counselor of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party and a son of Song Si Baek, a pro-reunification revolutionary martyr, on Monday to express deep condolences over his death on March 28.

Chinese and German Delegations Here
